original: HAMMAR, Victor, överingenjör, Bofors, f Filip stad 14/10 80 av verkm G Olsson o Maria Nilsdtr, gm fil kand Karin Nilsson. Bergssk i Filipst 95—96, öbr tekn gymn 01. övering o tekn ch f AB Bofors. RNO, RVO, KUngFO, OffPolRest, RDDO, RFinlVROlkl, LKrVa, LIVA, KorrespLöS, Arnb pris 42, I VA: s GM.
translated: HAMMAR, Victor, senior engineer, Bofors, b. Filipstad on October 14th, 1880, son of factory worker G Olsson and Maria Nilsdtr, m. Karin Nilsson, B.A. (short for bachelor of arts). Attended the Mining School in Filipstad from 1895 to 1896, and studied technical sciences at a gymn (abbreviation for technical school) from 1901. Became senior engineer and technical chief of AB Bofors. Decorated with the Order of the Polar Star, the Order of Vasa, the Royal Order of the Sword, the Officer of the Polish Order of Restitution, the Royal Finnish Lions Medal, the Commemorative Cross of the Order of Vasa, the Order of the Lion with the Grand Cross, the King's Medal for Exceptionally Meritorious Service, the Corresponding Fellow of the Swedish Royal Academy of Sciences, and the Grand Master of the Royal Swedish Society of Naval Sciences. Awarded the Arnberg Memorial Prize in 1942, and a member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences.
